member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WinForms.TradingChart.SaveToFile(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Save the chart into a image file. Custom size can be defined via width and height parameters.
member.param: Target file name. You must include file extension (png, bmp, jpg, tif, gif, wmf, emf, svg).
Width of required output in pixels
Height of required output in pixels

Allows screen coordinates of certain elements to be scaled by factor of defined size and original size to keep then in place in relation to other chart elements in vector exports. If unsure, use value true. Should be set to false if annotation tables or such constructs are used. Affects only vector output (emf and svg).
member.returns: True if the image was successfully written to file. Returns false on invalid file extension, on file write failure and on other problems on image creation or saving.

member.name: T:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WinForms.TechnicalIndicators.BollingerBand
member.summary: Bollinger Band® is a technical analysis tool defined by a set of lines plotted typically two standard deviations (up and down) away from a simple moving average (SMA) of the security's price. Many traders believe the closer the prices move to the upper band, the more overbought the market, and the closer the prices move to the lower band, the more oversold the market.

member.summary: The Money Flow Index (MFI) uses price and volume data for identifying overbought or oversold signals. It can also be used to spot divergences which warn of a trend change in price. MFI moves between 0 and 100. Unlike many other oscillators such as the Relative Strength Index (RSI), the Money Flow Index incorporates both price and volume data.

member.name: T:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WinForms.TechnicalIndicators.MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence
member.summary:
Moving Average Convergence Divergence indicator (MACD). Appears below main price chart.
MACD line is the difference between Exponentially weighted Moving Average (EMA) of Short period data, and EMA of Long period data. That is: EMA(price short period) - EMA(price long period).
Signal line is Signal period EMA of MACD.
Histogram shows the difference between MACD and Signal. That is: MACD - Signal.

member.name: T:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WinForms.TechnicalIndicators.OpenInterest
member.summary: Open interest is the total number of outstanding derivative contracts, such as options or futures that have not been settled for an asset. The total open interest does not count, nor does total of every buy and sell contract. Instead, open interest provides a more accurate picture of the options trading activity, and whether money flows into the futures and options market are increasing or decreasing. Shows as a little chart with a line below main price chart.

member.name: T:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WinForms.TechnicalIndicators.WilliamsPercentRange
member.summary: Williams Percent Range, also known as Williams %R, measures overbought and oversold levels by comparing the current closing price to the high-low range over a specific time period. Appears as a segment below the main price chart.

member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the overbought limit.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WinForms.TechnicalIndicators.WilliamsPercentRange.OverboughtRange
member.summary: Overbought range. Values above this are considered overbought. Default value is -20.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WinForms.TechnicalIndicators.WilliamsPercentRange.OversoldColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the oversold limit.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WinForms.TechnicalIndicators.WilliamsPercentRange.OversoldRange
member.summary: Oversold range. Values below this are considered oversold. Default value is -80.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WinForms.TechnicalIndicators.WilliamsPercentRange.PeriodCount
member.summary: The number of time periods in the William %R calculation, set to 14 days by default.
